alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 09 at 5:41PM CDT until May 09 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Scotts Bluff County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Northeastern Kimball County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Eastern Banner County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... * Until 515 PM MDT. * At 441 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Harrisburg, or 21 miles north of Kimball, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Kimball, Dix, Harrisburg, Wildcat Hills State Recreation Area, Wildcat Hills Campground and McGrew. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 24 and 34. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
